item.title: guard recklessly shoots CHA youth
item.dc:creator: MJohns
item.excerpt:encoded: 14-year-old Briannca McGee (pictured with hand to her face) was a victim of a beating by the security guard who later shot another youth at the CHA LeClaire Courts public housing complex on May 30. Here, she stands with other LeClaire Courts residents after a protest and rally outside the on-site private security companys office where the security officer was being questioned, as Chicago police officers stand guard. Photo by Beauty Turner

item.title: altgeld garden 1
item.dc:creator: MJohns
item.excerpt:encoded: The resident of this recently rehabbed apartment in the Altgeld Gardens public housing complex uses two bricks from outside to hold down the improperly placed kitchen countertop left by the CHA contractors hired for reconstruction of many of the old units. Photo by Mary C. Johns

item.title: altgeld garden 2
item.dc:creator: MJohns
item.excerpt:encoded: This long-closed building, located in the midst of the CHAs Altgeld Gardens public housing complex on the far South Side, continues to remain dormant. It was once home to a grocery store and Noomies Laundromat for residents use. Residents are now being bused at the property managment's expense to far distant laundromats to do their families washing. Photo by Mary C. Johns

item.title: Mary's 6 2 11 pic of Lewis Jordan trying to calm down distraught speakers during public hearing on CHA plans to drug test res
item.dc:creator: MJohns
item.excerpt:encoded: Chicago Housing Authority chief Lewis Jordan tries to calm down distraught tenants and their advocates at the Charles A. Hayes Family Investment Center the evening of Jun 2, 2011, during the public hearing to comment on the CHA’s plan to drug test all public housing tenants, and to also take away their defense provision in court proceedings to evict them if a family member or friend on their lease commits a crime on or off CHA property, regardless if the leaseholder had any knowledge of it. Photo by Mary C. Piemonte
